properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 6 at 10:30PM CST until February 7 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the Harpeth River...

Harpeth River At Franklin affecting Williamson County

. Heavy rains have caused the Harpeth River at Franklin to rise above Action
Stage. The river is expected to crest this evening and then fall below
action stage early Friday morning.

The Flood Advisory continues for
The Harpeth River At Franklin
* Until late tonight.
* At 9 PM Thursday the stage was 23.9 feet.
* Action stage is 22.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 30.0 feet.
* The river will continue to fall to near 11.8 feet by Saturday morning.
* At 24.0 feet...Flooding will affect areas along the Harpeth River from
Franklin to Bellevue. In Franklin, water will reach the city park, 4th Street,
and portions of Highway 431.
* At 23.0 feet...Water begins to inundate low lying areas along the banks,
including the nursery at Hillsboro Road and Fulton Greer Lane.
* At 22.0 feet...Flood waters reach Highway 431 (Lewisburg Pike) in Franklin.
properties.instruction:
Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or other local media for further information
from the National Weather Service.
